data.title: Twenty minutes with no acknowledgement after being seated, really?
data.text: We arrived on a Friday night, after the dinner rush, and were seated right away.  We waited for 15 minutes with no acknowledgement from a waiter or any of the multiple staff members walking by.  After 15 minutes we flagged a waitress down who briefly said she'd be back with us.  And after another five minutes of we just left.  Kind of blows my mind that management would be ok with that.  I've had their pizza to go, it's good, but if their staff isn't trained to notice customers don't have water, drinks or attention after 20 minutes, they've got bigger problems than their food.

data.title: Aaaaaah, good customer service...
data.text: I took a group of my assistants to lunch and we had a lovely time, the great food and customer service was a big part of that.  We ordered 3 different, non-traditional pizzas which were all delicious.  I highly recommend the urbn salad, as well.  When the waitress overheard that someone in our party has a nut allergy, she had a salad made just for her without the nuts - such great attention to detail!

data.title: Good thin crust pizza
data.text: I have gone at least 10 times and love the pizza, much better that all of pizza places in El Cajon including Marechiaro's on 2nd ave, Pericano's on Main st. and others.

data.title: Coal is Kool with Us!
data.text:
So we have been 2x within 3 days. Depending on where you grew up you will have different taste in pizza. We are NEasters and therefore constantly in search of NY style pizza. 

This means that we are typically settling since most shops that use that title in their name are far from it!  

Urbn claims a New Haven style and lives up to it. 

First trip we had a craft pie - margherita with extra cheese on 1/2. 

Second trip was a large plain cheese. 

Both delicious!

A small is plenty for 2 people unless you want cold pizza later - which is a good thing too. 

Treat yourself to an Urbn pizza soon 🍕😀

data.title: OK Place for a unique pizza
data.text:
First, they have stopped brewing their own beer.  That is OK with me but some are going to be disappointed. The craft beer market is packed with brewers.
The pizzas are unique, this is not your father's pizza.  However, I won't recommend one for there are plenty of choices.  There are other menu options, one is for brussels
sprouts which is very good and worth a try.
The service is fast and friendly.  Don't be concerned about the area, it is safe and parking is available.

data.title: Cold Pizza, Slow service
data.text:
Our server was very nice but her lack of experience showed, it's a brewery and I asked to have something like a Hefeweizen,  and she didn't know what it was :( 
we waited a long time for our pizza and the restaurant was probably only 20% occupied when we got our pizza it was cold and the dough dry and rubbery, flavor was not great either, I had high hopes for this restaurant since we don't have many restaurant options in East County.

data.title: Lunch visit
data.text: Just stopped in at lunch.  Nice urban decor and layout.  Very similar to Basic and other sister properties.  Coal fired Polpette pizza had great flavor, not overwhelming but just right. Wanted to try the beers but too quick a visit.

data.title: Great pizza, salads and craft beer
data.text: Urbn has a fabulous selection of thin crust coal-fired pizzas.  You can order one of their signature pies, or make your own from a huge array of delicious veggies and meats.  Order the medium as the large has a crust that is stretched too thin and burns easily.  Our waiter warned us about this, and we knew from experience that it was true.  This is not your average pizza.  The Urbn salad with baby greens, pears, nuts, gorgonzola and balsamic vinaigrette is a great accompaniment.  A friend from the east coast has been looking in So Cal for a grinder on an amoroso roll.  You can find it here.  Shaved parmesan, salami, fresh tomatoes, lettuce, and radicchio.  Other great salad and appetizer choices.  The waiters will help you with your beer choices, and give you samples to try. Finally, an El Cajon restaurant with a chef who knows how to make exceptionally tasty food from scratch.

data.title: Great atmosphere and food!
data.text: Wonderful large pizza pies!  Nice collection of beers - their own and other craft beers.  Visited one evening during a big rainstorm - great to be warm and dry while watching the rain through the large floor to ceiling window walls.

data.title: Good food!
data.text:
Visited Urbn for a birthday dinner and it was fantastic. The venue is great! Lots of space, good atmosphere, and when the weather is nice they open the door and the whole space becomes indoor/outdoor. 

Food, beer, and other beverages were good. Will definitely be going again.

data.title: Pizza dinner
data.text: I am a big fan of thin crust pizza. This place hits the mark. Gouda chicken pizza was really good. Margarita pizza had really good flavor. The BBQ wings were also really good. It was the first time I was every told a brewery was out of the beer I wanted. Still really good food. Desert cookie with ice cream had the kids attention. Service was very good. Place was busy on a Thursday night. Since it was my first visit I would guess it is always busy for dinner. Will definitely return again.

data.title: Great place to have dinner with friends or family
data.text: awesome atmosphere, great pizza and wings! try the beer sampler. Took my family here and had a great time, would be great with friends too!

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: Don't care much for beer myself but went with family and they were happy.  Of note are the great little pizzas made by hand.  I'd go back anytime for those.

data.title: GO to pizza!
data.text: This is our go to pizza place in east county!  My husband loves the bacon and potato pizza while I love the meatball one!  Service is mixed as some servers were awesome .. while others not so much .. but we will keep going as there are few options for food this good in EC! ...

data.title: Great place for weekday lunch
data.text:
This was a working lunch and honestly the place was so quiet.  It worked GREAT for a business setting.  Waitress was nice but not hovering.  Meatball sandwich was killer.  First Diet Coke was flat but next 2 were fine.

Nice large open dining area with a bar to the side.

data.title: great pizza, great service
data.text: My wife and I stumbled upon this place and were very happy that we did.  We had an awesome pizza and I had two delicious beers.  Our server was very friendly and knowledgable, especially when it came to the beers.  It was a cool atmosphere inside.  We will definitely be returning,

data.title: Sensational brews & food!
data.text: URBN Street Brewing is conveniently located in El Cajon’s quaint historic downtown. URBN is such a great place to hang out and enjoy scrumptious pizza and extraordinary beer. The lunch special is a good deal as you can get a slice of pizza and side salad for only nine bucks. They also run a tremendous happy hour and thriving catering business.

data.title: Best pizza in east county
data.text: Best pizza ever and a better beer selection.  All the employees are very courteous and helpful explaining their menu

data.title: Great food and friendly staff
data.text: We had a great dinner with friendly, fun staff, tasty beer and delicious pizza. This location is much easier for us to get to than the one downtown and has plenty of parking.

data.title: Fun local hangout
data.text: We love the pizza and beer here! All the staff has been very nice and excited about the beer they have to offer. We are able to take our dog and sit outside on the patio. Great meal.
